properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 8 at 12:30PM EST until February 8 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW IMPACTING PORTIONS OF THE WESTERN CAROLINAS
AND NORTHEAST GEORGIA THIS AFTERNOON...

.Snow, perhaps changing to rain, will continue across the western
Carolinas and northeast Georgia into the afternoon, mainly across
the mountains, and in areas along and west of I-26 in the Piedmont.
The highest snow accumulations will occur near the junction of
the Georgia, North Carolina, and South Carolina borders in the
extreme southern Appalachians.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two
inches.

* WHERE...Rabun and Habersham Counties in extreme northeast
Georgia and Macon County in western North Carolina.

* WHEN...Through 7 PM EST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Accumulating snow on area roadways, and reduced
visibility in snow, could make travel very difficult.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National
Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a
message with your observation and the specific location where it
occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather
Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook or tweet your report
using hashtag nwsgsp.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of
weather information for the latest updates. Additional details
can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING
